A qaqqini file contains all of the attributes that can potentially impact the performance of the DB2 UDB for iSeries database engine. This property is valid for V5R3 and later.

resourceProperties.name: toolboxTrace
resourceProperties.description: Specifies what category of a toolbox trace to log. Trace messages are useful for debugging programs that call JDBC. However, there is a performance penalty associated with logging trace messages, so this property should only be set for debugging. Trace messages are logged to System.out. The possible values are:'none','datastream' (log data flow between the local host and the remote system),'diagnostic' (log object state information), 'error' (log errors that cause an exception), 'information' (used to track the flow of control through the code), 'warning' (log errors that are recoverable), 'conversion' (log character set conversions between Unicode and native code pages), 'proxy' (log data flow between the client and the proxy server),'pcml' (used to determine how PCML interprets the data that is sent to and from the server), 'jdbc' (log jdbc information), 'all' (log all categories), 'thread' (log thread information)

resourceProperties.name: translateHex
resourceProperties.description: Specifies how hexadecimal literals are interpreted. The possible values are - character, binary

resourceProperties.name: trueAutoCommit
resourceProperties.description: Specifies whether the connection should use true auto commit support. True autocommit means that autocommit is on and is running under a isolation level other than *NONE. By default, the driver handles autocommit by running under the server isolation level of *NONE. The possible values are - true, false

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-test connection is enabled in j2c.properties, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1 FROM TABLE1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table TABLE1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: This String property specifies the location-name of the database that should be used when establishing connections using this data source object. If location-name is not the local site of the DB2 Subsystem (See DB2SQLJSSID property in db2sqljjdbc.properties file), then location-name must be defined in SYSIBM.LOCATIONS. If location-name is the local site, then location-name must have been specified in the field DB2 LOCATION NAME of the DISTRIBUTED DATA FACILITY panel during the DB2 installation. If this property is NOT set (i.e. is null or is defined with an empty String), then connections established using this data source object will be made to the local site.

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. This property must be set and it identifies which database to access. For example, g:/db/wombat.

resourceProperties.name: shutdownDatabase
resourceProperties.description: If set to the string 'shutdown', this will cause the database to shutdown when a java.sql.Connection object is obtained from the Data Source. E.g., If the Data Source is an XADataSource, a getXAConnection().getConnection() is necessary to cause the database to shutdown

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: Name for ConnectionPooledDataSource or XADataSource. Not used by the Data Source object. Used for informational purpose only.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: Description of the Data Source. Not used by the Data Source object. Used for informational purpose only.

resourceProperties.name: connectionAttributes
resourceProperties.description: Connection attributes specific to Cloudscape. Please see Cloudscape documentation for a complete list of features.

resourceProperties.name: createDatabase
resourceProperties.description: If set to the string 'create', this will cause a new database of DatabaseName if that database does not already exist. The database is created when a connection object is obtained from the Data Source.

factories.name: Cloudscape Network Server DataSource

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. This property must be set and it identifies which database to access. For example, 'g:\\db\\wombat' or 'E:\\db2Sample\\newDBj;create=true'.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: Server hosting the Cloudscape Server.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: The port number the Cloudscape network Server is listening on.

resourceProperties.name: driverType
resourceProperties.description: This is the driver type, only type4 is supported.

resourceProperties.name: traceLevel
resourceProperties.description: The trace level for logging to the logWriter or trace file. Possible trace levels are: TRACE_NONE = 0,TRACE_CONNECTION_CALLS = 1,TRACE_STATEMENT_CALLS = 2,TRACE_RESULT_SET_CALLS = 4,TRACE_DRIVER_CONFIGURATION = 16,TRACE_CONNECTS = 32,TRACE_DRDA_FLOWS = 64,TRACE_RESULT_SET_META_DATA = 128,TRACE_PARAMETER_META_DATA = 256,TRACE_DIAGNOSTICS = 512,TRACE_SQLJ = 1024,TRACE_ALL = -1, .

resourceProperties.name: traceFile
resourceProperties.description: The trace file to store the trace output.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-test connection is enabled in j2c.properties, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1 FROM TABLE1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table TABLE1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: retrieveMessagesFromServerOnGetMessage
resourceProperties.description: Directs all calls to the standard JDBC SQLException.getMessage() to invoke a server-side stored procedure which retrieves the readable message text for the error.

resourceProperties.name: fullyMaterializeLobData
resourceProperties.description: This setting controls whether or not LOB locators are used to fetch LOB data. If enabled, LOB data is not streamed, but is fully materialized with locators when the user requests a stream on the LOB column. The default value is true. At this point cloudscape only supports true

resourceProperties.name: deferPrepares
resourceProperties.description: This property provides a performance directive that affects the internal semantics of the input data type conversion capability of the driver. By default the Universal driver defers 'internal prepare requests'. In this case, the driver works without the benefit of described parameter or result set meta data until execute time. So undescsribed input data is sent 'as is' to the server without any data type cross-conversation of the inputs.

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The name of the Informix instance on the physical machine

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number of the Informix instance

resourceProperties.name: ifxIFXHOST
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The physical machine name.

resourceProperties.name: informixLockModeWait
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property.By default, Informix throws an exception when it cannot acquire a lock, rather than waiting for the current owner of the lock to release it. To modify this behavior, set this property to the number of seconds to wait for a lock. The default is 2 seconds. Any negative value means to wait forever

resourceProperties.name: informixAllowNewLine
resourceProperties.description: This property allows newLines to be added on a query String. Its disabled by default

resourceProperties.name: roleName
resourceProperties.description: The role name.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMaxConnections
resourceProperties.description: The maximum number of physical connections that the datasource can obtain from the server, excluding those are returned to the server. Default value is -1 which means unlimited connections.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMinAgeLimit
resourceProperties.description: The minimum number of the connections kept in the pool has exceeded the age limit. Default value is 0.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMinPoolSize
resourceProperties.description: The minimum number of connections maintain in the pool. Default value is 0.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMaxPoolSize
resourceProperties.description: The maximum number of connections maintain in the pool. When the pool reaches this size, all connections are returned to the server. The default value is 50.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMAgeLimit
resourceProperties.description: The time, in seconds, that is specified for a free connection is kept in a free connection pool. The default value is -1, that means the free connections are retained in the free pool until the client terminates.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMServiceInterval
resourceProperties.description: The pool service frequency, in milliseconds. Default is 50.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMInitPoolSize
resourceProperties.description: The initial number of connections to be allocated in a pool when a datasource is first instantiated and the pool is created. Default value is 0.

resourceProperties.description: The role name.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMaxConnections
resourceProperties.description: The maximum number of physical connections that the datasource can obtain from the server, excluding those are returned to the server. Default value is -1 which means unlimited connections.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMinAgeLimit
resourceProperties.description: The minimum number of the connections kept in the pool has exceeded the age limit. Default value is 0.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMinPoolSize
resourceProperties.description: The minimum number of connections maintain in the pool. Default value is 0.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMMaxPoolSize
resourceProperties.description: The maximum number of connections maintain in the pool. When the pool reaches this size, all connections are returned to the server. The default value is 50.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMAgeLimit
resourceProperties.description: The time, in seconds, that is specified for a free connection is kept in a free connection pool. The default value is -1, that means the free connections are retained in the free pool until the client terminates.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMServiceInterval
resourceProperties.description: The pool service frequency, in milliseconds. Default is 50.

resourceProperties.name: ifxCPMInitPoolSize
resourceProperties.description: The initial number of connections to be allocated in a pool when a datasource is first instantiated and the pool is created. Default value is 0.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-test connection is enabled in j2c.properties, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1 FROM TABLE1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table TABLE1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: informixLockModeWait
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property.By default, Informix throws an exception when it cannot acquire a lock, rather than waiting for the current owner of the lock to release it. To modify this behavior, set this property to the number of seconds to wait for a lock. The default is 2 seconds. Any negative value means to wait forever

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The name of the server where Sybase resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the jdbc driver resides.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the protocol to be used. When set to socket, SSL encryption is not used. The possible values are: socket, SSL. Default is socket.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.description: The version of the driver.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: connectionProperties
resourceProperties.description: The properties that are needed for connection. Please refer to Sybase documentation for the appropriate properties.

resourceProperties.description: This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resourceProperties.name: driverType

resourceProperties.name: oraclelogPrintMask
resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogPrintMask controls which information is printed with each trace message. Oracle9i requires the use of ojdbc14_g.jar. Default is 62 which is ([OracleLog.FIELD_OBJECT for 9i / OracleLog.FIELD_CONN for 8i] 32 | OracleLog.FIELD_CATEGORY 16 | OracleLog.FIELD_SUBMOD 8 | OracleLog.FIELD_MODULE 4 | OracleLog.FIELD_TIME 2). Possible values: OracleLog.FIELD_TIME 2, OracleLog.FIELD_MODULE 4, OracleLog.FIELD_SUBMOD 8, OracleLog.FIELD_CATEGORY 16, OracleLog.FIELD_OBJECT 32, OracleLog.FIELD_THREAD 64

resourceProperties.name: oraclelogModuleMask
resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogModuleMask controls which modules write debug output. Oracle9i requires the use of ojdbc14_g.jar. Default is 1 which is ( OracleLog.MODULE_DRIVER 1). Possible values (OracleLog.MODULE_DRIVER 1, OracleLog.MODULE_DBACCESS 2)

resourceProperties.name: oraclelogCategoryMask
resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogCategoryMask controls which category to be output. Oracle9i requires the use of ojdbc14_g.jar. Default is 47 which is ( OracleLog.USER_OPER 1 | OracleLog.PROG_ERROR 2 | OracleLog.ERROR 4 | OracleLog.WARNING 8 | OracleLog.DEBUG1 32). Possible values (OracleLog.USER_OPER 1, OracleLog.PROG_ERROR 2, OracleLog.ERROR 4, OracleLog.WARNING 8, OracleLog.FUNCTION 16, OracleLog.DEBUG1 32, OracleLog.SQL_STR 128)

resourceProperties.name: oraclelogCategoryMask
resourceProperties.description: The oraclelogCategoryMask controls which category to be output. Oracle9i requires the use of ojdbc14_g.jar. Default is 47 which is ( OracleLog.USER_OPER 1 | OracleLog.PROG_ERROR 2 | OracleLog.ERROR 4 | OracleLog.WARNING 8 | OracleLog.DEBUG1 32). Possible values (OracleLog.USER_OPER 1, OracleLog.PROG_ERROR 2, OracleLog.ERROR 4, OracleLog.WARNING 8, OracleLog.FUNCTION 16, OracleLog.DEBUG1 32, OracleLog.SQL_STR 128)

resourceProperties.name: TNSEntryName
resourceProperties.description: The entry name which is used for the Oracle OCI driver.

resourceProperties.name: networkProtocol
resourceProperties.description: Whether to use TCP/IP or IPC or any other protocol

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the server

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: The TCP/IP port number where the jdbc driver resides.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: URL
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The URL indicating the database from which the Data Source will obtain connections, such as 'jdbc:oracle:thin:@localhost:1521:sample'.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: transactionBranchesLooselyCoupled
resourceProperties.description: This property is introduced as a result of Oraclebug 2511780, Oracle Patch for 2511780 must be installed before setting this property to true, failure to do that would cause a program error. Please check the WebSphere readme file for more info .

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-test connection is enabled in j2c.properties, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1 FROM TABLE1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table TABLE1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.name: DataDirect ConnectJDBC type 4 driver for MS SQL Server
resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: DataDirect ConnectJDBC type 4 driver for MS SQL Server.

factories.name: DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server - 4.0 DataSource

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The name of the server where MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. Values are 'cursor' or 'direct'. The default is 'direct'. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: The spy attributes.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When false (by default), two phase connections are used. When true, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: maxPooledStatements
resourceProperties.description: The maximum number of pooled PreparedStatements for this connection. The default is 0.

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether string parameters are sent to the SQL Server database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: codePageOverride
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the codepage the driver uses when converting character data. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Determines the amount of memory used by the driver to cache insensitive result set data. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

factories.name: DataDirect ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource

The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

factories.name: WebSphere embedded ConnectJDBC for SQL Server DataSource

resourceProperties.name: databaseName
resourceProperties.description: The database name. For example, enter sample to make your Data Source point to sample

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The name of the server where MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where the MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. Values are 'cursor' or 'direct'. The default is 'direct'. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dataSourceName
resourceProperties.description: The name of the Data Source.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: The spy attributes.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: enable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When true, two phase connections are used. When false, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: maxPooledStatements
resourceProperties.description: The maximum number of pooled PreparedStatements for this connection. The default is 0.

resourceProperties.name: sendStringParametersAsUnicode
resourceProperties.description: Determines whether string parameters are sent to the SQL Server database in Unicode or in the default character encoding of the database. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-test connection is enabled in j2c.properties, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1 FROM TABLE1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table TABLE1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: codePageOverride
resourceProperties.description: Specifies the codepage the driver uses when converting character data. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: Determines the amount of memory used by the driver to cache insensitive result set data. See the ConnectJDBC documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: alternateServers
resourceProperties.description: Enables support for connection failover. The value of the AlternateServers connection option is a string that specifies the server name and port number of alternate servers that can be tried if the primary server is not accepting connections for some reason. This string has the format: (servername1:port1,servername2:port2, ..., servernameN:portN). To use named instances, the format is: (servername1\\instance1,servername2\\instance2, ..., servernameN\\instanceN). See the Connect JDBC driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.

resources.jdbc:JDBCProvider.description: Deprecated - Please use the Connect JDBC driver instead.

factories.name: Deprecated - DataDirect SequeLink for SQL Server - 4.0 DataSource
factories.description: a New Microsoft SQLServer JDBC Datasource (via DataDirect SequeLink type 3)

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP address of the SequeLink server in dotted format or host name format.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP port on which the SequeLink service is listening.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes
resourceProperties.description: The SPY attributes. See the SequeLink documentation for a list of attributes.

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout
resourceProperties.description: The maximum time to attempt to connect a database. If this value is non-zero, attempt to connect to the database will timeout when this specified value is reached.

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: The description of this datasource.

resourceProperties.name: cipherSuites
resourceProperties.description: The Secure Socket Layer(SSL) cipher suites with which the SequeLink Java Client can use to connect. This property is required when networkProtocol=ssl.

resourceProperties.name: blockFetchForUpdate
resourceProperties.description: When the isolation level is ReadCommitted and a SELECT FOR UPDATE statement is issued against some data stores, the SequeLink Java Client does not lock the expected row. Default is 1 which does not lock the expected row.

resourceProperties.name: SLKStaticCursorLongColBuffLen
resourceProperties.description: The amount of data (in KB) that is buffered for SQL_LONGVARCHAR and SQL_LONGVARBINARY columns which an insensitive result set. Default is 4.

resourceProperties.name: certificateChecker
resourceProperties.description: The fully qualified class name of a user-defined server certificate checker class.

resourceProperties.name: serverDataSource
resourceProperties.description: A property that specifies a string to identify the server Data Source to be used for the connection. If unspecified, the configuration of the default server Data Source will be used for the connection.

resourceProperties.name: disable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When false , two phase connections are used. When true, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: applicationName
resourceProperties.description: Identifies the application that is establishing the Connections. When the application does not provide a value, the default value is SequeLink JDBC Application.

resourceProperties.name: MSSMapLongToDecimal
resourceProperties.description: Enable client-side workarounds. Refer to the SequeLink Administrator's Guide.

resourceProperties.name: ORANumber0IsNumeric
resourceProperties.description: Enable client-side workarounds. Refer to the SequeLink Administrator's Guide.

resourceProperties.name: allowPrefetch
resourceProperties.description: Enables the prefetch feature. When enabled, the JDBC driver requests a next set of rows from the server while the client is processing the previous set of rows. 0 = disable; 1 = enable.

resourceProperties.name: insensitiveResultSetBufferSize
resourceProperties.description: The memory caching scheme for scroll-insensitive cursors. When set to 0, the driver uses a memory caching mechanism that does not use disk overflow. When set to a value greater than 0, data overflows to disk when the size of cached data exceeds the specified amount, specified in kilobytes. When set to a value less than 0, the data provider providers better performance. However, memory use may be affected.

resourceProperties.name: serverName
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP address of the SequeLink server in dotted format or host name format.

resourceProperties.name: portNumber
resourceProperties.description: This is a required property. The TCP/IP port number where MS SQL Server resides.

resourceProperties.name: selectMethod
resourceProperties.description: Determine whether or not Microsoft SQL Server 'server cursors' are used for SQL queries. Default value is cursor. Direct mode is more efficient, but it limits applications to a single active Statement while in a transaction. See the Microsoft driver documentation for more information.

Direct mode is more efficient, but it limits applications to a single active Statement while in a transaction. See the Microsoft driver documentation for more information.

resourceProperties.name: spyAttributes

resourceProperties.name: loginTimeout

resourceProperties.name: description

resourceProperties.name: enable2Phase
resourceProperties.description: When true, two phase connections are used. When false, one phase connections are used. Do not change this value because this value is set for with this provider

resourceProperties.name: enableMultithreadedAccessDetection
resourceProperties.description: Indicates whether or not to detect multithreaded access to a Connection and its corresponding Statements, ResultSets, and MetaDatas.

resourceProperties.name: preTestSQLString
resourceProperties.description: This SQL statement is used for pre-test connection function. For example, SELECT 1 FROM [TESTTABLE]. If pre-test connection is enabled in j2c.properties, this SQL statement will be executed to the connection to make sure the connection is good. If you leave this field blank, the default SQL statement, SELECT 1 FROM TABLE1, will be used at runtime. This will slow down the execution because of the exception handling if table TABLE1 is not defined in the database. Users are recommended to provide their own SQL statement to improve the performance.

resourceProperties.name: dbFailOverEnabled
resourceProperties.description: This flag should be set to true only if the backend database is configured with failover capability. This flag will indicate to WebSphere to validate connections when they first get created and to keep trying to get a good connection from the database when the validation fails.

resourceProperties.name: connRetriesDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls how many times WebSphere will try to get a connection from the database before giving up

resourceProperties.name: connRetryIntervalDuringDBFailover
resourceProperties.description: This is useful only if dbFailOverEnabled flag is true. This property controls the interval between retries to retrieve a connection from the database.
